info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued July 31 at 3:07AM MDT until August 01 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS Glasgow
info.description: ...CRITICAL FIRE WEATHER CONDITIONS POSSIBLE MONDAY AFTERNOON AND EVENING... .Rapidly drying fuels, exceptionally low humidity, hot temperatures and breezy conditions from a frontal passage on Monday will bring elevated to potentially critical fire danger across all of northeast Montana for Monday afternoon and evening. ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH MONDAY EVENING FOR VERY LOW HUMIDITY, HEAT AND DRY FUELS FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 120, 122, 134, 135, 136, AND 137... * AFFECTED AREA...Fire Weather Zones 120, 122, 134, 135, 136 and 137. * TIMING...Noon through 9PM Monday. * WINDS...West 10 to 20 mph with gusts up to 30 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 7 percent. * TEMPERATURES...In the lower 90s. * IMPACTS...A combination of dry fuels, gusty winds, hot temperatures and very low humidity could lead to fire runs toward the east with any starts.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in these areas of this Fire Weather Watch.
